title: Raynald of Châtillon
summary: Raynald of Châtillon (French: Renaud; c. 1125 – 4 July 1187), also known as Reynald or Reginald, was Prince of Antioch from 1153 to 1160 or 1161, and Lord of Oultrejordain from 1175 until his death. He was born the second son of a French noble family. After losing a part of his patrimony, he joined the Second Crusade in 1147. He settled in the Kingdom of Jerusalem and served in the royal army as a mercenary.
